tools.name: listTerminals
tools.description: List all named terminals currently active in VS Code with their creation dates and status

tools.name: createTerminal
tools.description: Create a new named terminal with a specific name for easy identification

shellPath.description: Optional path to shell executable (defaults to system default)

cwd.description: Optional working directory for the terminal

tools.name: sendCommandOrCreate
tools.description: Send a command to a specific named terminal, creating it if it doesn't exist. Optionally capture command output.

terminalName.description: Name of the target terminal to send the command to (will be created if it doesn't exist)

command.description: Command to execute in the terminal (e.g., 'npm start', 'git status')

cwd.description: Working directory for the terminal if it needs to be created (optional)

shellPath.description: Path to the shell executable if the terminal needs to be created (optional)

captureOutput.description: Whether to capture and return the command output (optional, defaults to false)

tools.name: executeCommandWithOutput
tools.description: Execute a command in a named terminal and capture its output, error messages, and execution details

terminalName.description: Name of the target terminal to execute the command in (will be created if it doesn't exist)

command.description: Command to execute and capture output from (e.g., 'npm test', 'ls -la')

cwd.description: Working directory for the command execution (optional)

shellPath.description: Path to the shell executable for command execution (optional)

tools.name: renameTerminal
tools.description: Rename an existing named terminal to a new name

oldName.description: Current name of the terminal to rename

tools.name: deleteTerminal
tools.description: Delete/dispose a named terminal and close it

name.description: Name of the terminal to delete
